com.jgcomptech.tools.databasetools.jbdc

Class Database.Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jgcomptech.tools.databasetools.jbdc.Database.Settings
  • Enclosing class:
    Database

    public static class Database.Settings
extends Object

    Allows setting and retrieval of settings values from a database

    • Method Summary

      Creates a Settings table in the specified database

      Checks if a setting exists in the settings table

      • createTable

        public static void createTable(Database db,
                               boolean suppressExistsError)
                        throws SQLException

        Creates a Settings table in the specified database

        Parameters:
        db - the database to create the table in
        suppressExistsError - if true suppresses error if the table already exists
        Throws:
        SQLException - if error occurs

      • getValue

        public static String getValue(Database db,
                              String settingName)
                       throws SQLException

        Returns a setting from the settings table, if setting doesn’t exist, returns an empty string

        Parameters:
        db - database that contains the settings table
        settingName - name of the setting to return a value
        Returns:
        value of the specified setting
        Throws:
        SQLException - if error occurs

      • setValue

        public static boolean setValue(Database db,
                               String settingName,
                               String settingValue)
                        throws SQLException

        Sets a setting in the settings table, if setting doesn’t exist, it is created

        Parameters:
        db - database that contains the settings table
        settingName - name of the setting to set its value
        settingValue - value to set
        Returns:
        true if setting is set successfully
        Throws:
        SQLException - if error occurs

      • exists

        public static boolean exists(Database db,
                             String settingName)
                      throws SQLException

        Checks if a setting exists in the settings table

        Parameters:
        db - database that contains the settings table
        settingName - setting to check for
        Returns:
        true if setting exists
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a setting is defined multiple times
        SQLException - if error occurs
